miic.core.miic_utils.from_single_pattern_to_panel¶

from_single_pattern_to_panel(load_dir='.', save_dir='./save', fs=10.0, suffix='', old_style=False)[source]¶

Create pandas.Panel object recombining all corr and dv curves.

This function creates two pandas.Panel object recombining respectively all correlation curve and dv/v curve created for a specific dataset and one pandas.DataFrame containing all the metainformation in each stats object associated with one stations pair. Source timing, correlation value and velocity change are all stored in a matlab file with the name of this form (look at convert_to_matlab for a detailed description):

vchange_full_<pattern>_<suffix>_.mat

Suffix is equal to "_%sHz" % fs when old_style==True.

Patterns that are processed without errors are logged in a file success_patterns.npy saved in the save_dir directory.

Parameters:
  • load_dir (string) – Where the dv/v and corr curves are stored
  • save_dir (string) – Where the two Panels will be saved
  • fs (float) – Pseudo Sampling frequency for the corr curve
  • suffix (string) – Optional suffix for the filename to look for (it must be the same as used with the vchange_estimate function through with the corr ad dv/v curves were created)
  • old_style (bool) – If true, the suffic is generated using the fs ( “_<fs>Hz”) instead of being passed as a parameter)
